description:
The **AWSSupport-ValidateRdsNetworkConfiguration** runbook helps you prevent an Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS), Amazon Aurora, or Amazon DocumentDB database instance being marked as `incompatible-network` state before performing the `ModifyDBInstance` or `StartDBInstance` operations. If your database instance is already in `incompatible-network` state, the runbook tries to identify the reason by checking the network configuration.

The runbook performs the following steps:
> * Checks your current region elastic network interfaces quota.
> * Checks if all the DB subnet group associated subnets exists.
> * There are enough free IP addresses available in each subnet.
> * Checks the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) attributes (`enableDnsSupport` and `enableDnsHostnames`) are enabled if your Amazon RDS is publicly accessible.

For more information about troubleshooting `incompatible-network` state see [How do I resolve issues with an Amazon DocumentDB instance that is in an incompatible-network state?](https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/documentdb-incompatible-network) and [How do I resolve issues with an Amazon RDS database that is in an incompatible-network state?](https://repost.aws/knowledge-center/rds-incompatible-network)

### Important
For Amazon Aurora or Amazon DocumentDB clusters please use the `InstanceIdentifier` as a parameter, not the `ClusterIdentifier` for Amazon RDS DB instances.

AutomationAssumeRole.description: (Optional) The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) role that allows Systems Manager Automation to perform the actions on your behalf. If no role is specified, Systems Manager Automation uses the permissions of the user that starts this runbook.

DBInstanceIdentifier.description: (Required) The Amazon Aurora or Amazon DocumentDB instance identifier.

mainSteps.name: assertRdsState
mainSteps.description: Checks if the provided instance identifier exists and has any of the following states: available, stopped or incompatible-network.

mainSteps.name: gatherRdsInformation
mainSteps.description: Gets details about the RDS instance properties and its network configuration.

mainSteps.name: checkEniQuota
mainSteps.description: Checks for the current available quota of Amazon ENI for the region.

import logging
from typing import Any, Dict, Union

import boto3
from botocore.errorfactory import ClientError

log = logging.getLogger()
log.setLevel(logging.INFO)

# Network Interface QuotaCode
ENI_QUOTA_CODE = "L-DF5E4CA3"


def get_eni_quota_usage(events, context):
    result: dict = {"EniQuota": {"total": 0, "used": 0, "available": 0}, "Check": {"Status": "", "Detail": []}}
    # get region and partition
    region = context["global:REGION"]
    partition = context["global:AWS_PARTITION"]

    service_quota = boto3.client("service-quotas", region_name=region)

    # Skip quota check for ISO partitions where Service Quotas is not available
    if partition in ["aws-iso", "aws-iso-b"]:
        status = "PASSED"
        message_detail = "ENI quota check skipped in ISO/ISO-B partition where Service Quotas is not available."
        result["Check"]["Status"] = status
        result["Check"]["Detail"] = [message_detail]
        return result

    ec2 = boto3.client("ec2", region_name=region)

    try:
        service_quota = boto3.client("service-quotas", region_name=region)
        # define the options dictionary as per the get_service_quota API input parameters
        options: Dict[Union[str, bytes], Any] = {}
        options = {"ServiceCode": "vpc", "QuotaCode": ENI_QUOTA_CODE}

        result["EniQuota"]["total"] = int(service_quota.get_service_quota(**options)["Quota"]["Value"])

        # modify options dictonary to only have MaxResults which is needed by describe_network_interfaces
        options = {"MaxResults": 1000}

        while True:
            nw_interfaces_response = ec2.describe_network_interfaces(**options)
            result["EniQuota"]["used"] += len(nw_interfaces_response["NetworkInterfaces"])

            if result["EniQuota"]["total"] == result["EniQuota"]["used"]:
                break

            try:
                options["NextToken"] = nw_interfaces_response["NextToken"]
            except KeyError:
                break

        result["EniQuota"]["available"] = result["EniQuota"]["total"] - result["EniQuota"]["used"]

        if result["EniQuota"]["available"] > 16:
            status = "PASSED"
            message_detail = f"Quota for Elastic Network Interface (ENIs) ({result['EniQuota']['available']}) is sufficient at the moment."
        elif result["EniQuota"]["available"] <= 16 and result["EniQuota"]["available"] != 0:
            status = "WARNING"
            message_detail = f"Quota for Elastic Network Interface (ENIs) ({result['EniQuota']['available']}) is sufficient at the moment, but please make sure to have more quota to accomodate ongoing changes.\n"
        else:
            status = "FAILED"
            message_detail = "Quota for Elastic Network Interface (ENIs) (0) is not sufficient at the moment.\n"

        if status != "PASSED":
            message_detail += "o Either remove existing ENIs that are not in use or raise a limit increase request to increase the quota.\n"
            message_detail += "   [+] Request an increase: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/ec2-resource-limits.html#request-increase\n"

    except ClientError as error:
        status = "FAILED"
        message_detail = f"Failed to call the API operation - {error.response['Error']['Code']}\n"
        message_detail += "o Please make sure that the user/role has the permission `servicequotas:GetServiceQuota`, if the permission is missing \n  please provide the user/role with permissions and re-run the automation.\n"

        log.error(f"Failed to call the API operation - {error}")

    result["Check"]["Status"] = status
    result["Check"]["Detail"] = message_detail.splitlines()

    return result

mainSteps.name: validateVpcAttributes
mainSteps.description: Checks if the DNS related parameters are set to `true` if the instance is `PubliclyAccessible`.

mainSteps.name: validateSubnetAttributes
mainSteps.description: Validates the existence of subnets in the DBSubnetGroup and checks for available IPs for each subnet.

mainSteps.name: generateReport
mainSteps.description: Generates a consolidated report including information about the checks performed and next steps if any steps failed.

# check icons
STATUS = {
    "PASSED": "\u2705",  # Check Mark
    "WARNING": "\u2757",  # ! Symbol
    "FAILED": "\u274c",  # Red Cross Mark
    "SKIPPED": "\u23e9",  # Right-Pointing Double Triangle
    "ERROR": "\u26d4",  # Dash in between circle
    "SUCCESS": "\u2705",
}


def generate_report(events, context):
    rds_identifier = events.get("DBInstanceIdentifier")
    rds_state = events.get("State")
    rds_engine = events.get("Engine")
    rds_ismaz = events.get("IsMaz")

    eniquota_check = events.get("ENICheck")
    vpcattr_check = events.get("VPCCheck")
    subnets_check = events.get("SubnetChecks")

    # docdb aurora-postgresql postgres
    if rds_engine.startswith("aurora"):
        instance_type = "Aurora DB"
    elif rds_engine == "docdb":
        instance_type = "DocumentDB DB"
    else:
        instance_type = "RDS"

    report = []
    cluster_notes = []
    heading_text = [
        f"# AWS {instance_type} Network Configuration Checks: {rds_identifier} ({rds_state})",
        f"## {STATUS['SUCCESS']} No Issue(s) Found",
        "\n### [Troubleshooting Results]",
    ]
    check_messages = [
        f"1. Checking ENI Quota for region the {instance_type} Instance is in:",
        "2. Checking VPC Attribute (`enableDnsHostname` & `enableDnsSupport`) settings:",
        f"3. Checking if subnets required for {instance_type} exists or not:",
        "4. Checking if Available IPs are sufficient per subnets that are required:",
        "5. Checking if other Availability zone satisfy Check No# 3 & 4:",
    ]
    # notes/disclaimer
    notes_message = [
        "\nDisclaimer: Please note that Check 5 is only valid if you are going to perform a MultiAZ conversion,\nif you are not trying to perform a MultiAZ conversion then you can ignore the Check 5.",
        "If any of the availability zone above has status as FAILED/WARNING then, please check the respective availability zone.",
    ]

    # add notes for clsuters (aurora/docdb)
    if (rds_engine.startswith("aurora") or rds_engine == "docdb") and rds_state == "incompatible-network":
        cluster_type = rds_engine.title() if rds_engine.startswith("aurora") else "DocumentDB"
        cluster_notes = [
            f"o To resolve the `incompatible-network` state for Amazon {cluster_type} Instance, please add a new instance to the cluster,\n"
            "   and delete the instance which is in `incompatible-network` state."
        ]
        if rds_engine == "aurora":
            cluster_notes.append(
                "   [+] Adding Aurora Replicas to a DB cluster : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/AuroraUserGuide/aurora-replicas-adding.html"
            )
        else:
            cluster_notes.append(
                "   [+] Adding an Amazon DocumentDB instance to a cluster : https://docs.aws.amazon.com/documentdb/latest/developerguide/db-instance-add.html"
            )

    # check if any of the checks failed
    if (
        eniquota_check["Status"] == "FAILED"
        or vpcattr_check["Status"] == "FAILED"
        or subnets_check["Existance"]["Status"] == "FAILED"
        or subnets_check["FreeIp"]["Status"] == "FAILED"
    ):
        heading_text[1] = f"### {STATUS['ERROR']} Issue(s) Found!!!"

    # add heading to the report
    report += heading_text

    # first check - eni quota
    report.append(check_messages[0])
    report.append(f" {STATUS[eniquota_check['Status']]} [{eniquota_check['Status']}] : {eniquota_check['Detail'][0]}\n")

    # second check - vpc attributes
    report.append(check_messages[1])
    report.append(f" {STATUS[vpcattr_check['Status']]} [{vpcattr_check['Status']}] : {vpcattr_check['Detail'][0]}\n")

    # third check - subnet existance
    report.append(check_messages[2])
    report.append(
        f" {STATUS[subnets_check['Existance']['Status']]} [{subnets_check['Existance']['Status']}] : {subnets_check['Existance']['Detail'][0]}\n"
    )

    # forth check - subnet existance
    report.append(check_messages[3])
    report.append(
        f" {STATUS[subnets_check['FreeIp']['Status']]} [{subnets_check['FreeIp']['Status']}] : {subnets_check['FreeIp']['Detail'][0]}\n"
    )

    # fifth check - other az if saz, skip if aurora or docdb
    if (not rds_ismaz and subnets_check["OtherAz"]) and not (rds_engine.startswith("aurora") or rds_engine == "docdb"):
        report.append(check_messages[4])
        for az in subnets_check["OtherAz"]:
            report.append(f"  * Availability Zone: {az}")
            report.append(
                f"      i. Subnet Existance Check: {STATUS[subnets_check['OtherAz'][az]['Subnet']]} [{subnets_check['OtherAz'][az]['Subnet']}]"
            )
            report.append(
                f"     ii. Available IP Check: {STATUS[subnets_check['OtherAz'][az]['FreeIP']]} [{subnets_check['OtherAz'][az]['FreeIP']}]"
            )

    # check next steps
    report.append("\n### [Next Steps]")

    if cluster_notes:
        report += cluster_notes

    if eniquota_check["Status"] != "PASSED":
        report += eniquota_check["Detail"][1:]

    if vpcattr_check["Status"] != "PASSED":
        report += vpcattr_check["Detail"][1:]

    if subnets_check["Existance"]["Status"] != "PASSED":
        report += subnets_check["Existance"]["Detail"][1:]

    if subnets_check["FreeIp"]["Status"] != "PASSED" and subnets_check["FreeIp"]["Status"] != "SKIPPED":
        report += subnets_check["FreeIp"]["Detail"][1:]

    if heading_text[1] == f"## {STATUS['SUCCESS']} No Issue(s) Found" and (
        eniquota_check["Status"]
        == subnets_check["Existance"]["Status"]
        == subnets_check["FreeIp"]["Status"]
        == "PASSED"
        and vpcattr_check["Status"] in ["SKIPPED", "PASSED"]
    ):
        report.append(
            f"\n{STATUS['SUCCESS']} All the checks has passed so the {instance_type} Network configuration is correct."
        )

    # add notes/disclaimer if not aurora/docdb
    if (not rds_ismaz and subnets_check["OtherAz"]) and not (rds_engine.startswith("aurora") or rds_engine == "docdb"):
        report += notes_message

    return "\n".join(report)
